comments.body: What if you could ride them

This would harm endangered species also this would be very niche armor.

An alternative could be Penguin down granted upon the growing up of Penguin chicks which could be used to line armor instead, granting immunity to powder snow or softening blows from attacks by half a heart

Ah, no penguin slaughtering! Mojang wouldn't endorse that. They would definitely endorse cute penguins, I think, but their benefits would just be that they're a cute mob to add environment to the world. Maybe if you get one to trust you, they bring you fish in return, and could grant a swimming bonus, like dolphins. 

Extra bonus: Add fairy penguins, specifically. They're a bit niche, but they're the Australian Little Penguin, which is the smallest type of penguin, and also the cutest. I request this specifically because it would give them some recognition, and in real life, sheepdogs have been used to protect them, so maybe wolves and them could have some cute interaction as a nod to this?
That would be sooo cute

The Penguins that they should add would be based off of the fairy penguin and the emperor penguin and the feathers would drop randomly like chickens drop eggs and how do you breed them using fish and one of the parents will have the egg in between their legs until the penguin hatches
And they can replace iron golems?

That’s a good idea weapons are already traded by blacksmith but say they give emeralds and tipped arrows(bedrock) for rotten flesh bones etc also they seem like a good villager and not one you want to get killed so maybe they have bows and will have a specific building they can shoot from without leaving to get hurt
Iron golems exist instead. Villagers are intentionally pacifists, that will not change.
you could ride them. they jump really high but they go really slow
It would be amazing for when they re-work the badlands biome!
Adding them with the Sniffer is the perfect opportunity!
I think that if you want the moobloom, it should just spawn naturally.
Brilliant it would also give another use to the sniffer
Eso estaría chido

Why? What purpose would they serve? Where would they spawn? What would they look like? How much health have they and how fast are they?

As this is a mob included in many mods, it probably won't be added. Sorry.
We need ducks just look how cute it would be minecraft .
In my post (lucky tree) I added a link to this idea! I hope it helps you get lots of votes!
I think ducks would be a great idea because they are so cute and it would be a nice little extra thing to have.
Ducks would be nice because they could have a function where they help you with fishing, or make it possible to have scrambled eggs or omelettes in the game.
good idea
Crows!

This idea really needs to be more developed. Why? What kinds? Where would they spawn? Would there be Nether or End variants? What would their stats be?                                                                 Dude to be onset you need to think about these things or else it will be alot harder to get them in the Game/MineCraft

But add Crows and a Dead variant of the Crows
And Crows can be tamed but
Not the dead variant
The dead variant is a hostile mob
Or just an ambient sound at least.

Yes, I think birds will add a lot to the game.
I'll also put my previous suggestion here since I think it fits.

Crows but realistic (so they're as smart as 5yo)  
https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/13136876967181-Crows-but-realistic-so-they-re-as-smart-as-5yo-
maby when you tame a wolf it will be a dog. and villages might have a chance of being a dog village rather than a cat village.
I like the idea. But I think they should also add cat beds and toys.
A good idea but it wouldn't be easy to entrap a single Vex.
+ MB with using souls which we can get with new sculk and mob experience-loss-mechanics, idrk but Vex&Allay similarity theory is interesting

I was going to suggest this idea, It would be a very interesting mechanic. Something like a single splash potion which instantly turns a vex into an allay. Since the Allay is kinda OP, it needs a difficult challenge to obtain it.

The only thing that you need to balance is that evokers will be less powerful.

This feels surprisingly Minecraft. 
Unlike the caves and cliffs features, this feels vanilla. 

How about using a totem of undying to a vex?
So if a vex activates your totem it would lose it's sword and start chiming. And to make this a little more challenging(idea from simply sarc) you could start placing chimes into the world. This could either be placing blocks of amethyst or playing note blocks. After 20 seconds of continuous music the vex converts.

OR 

Mojang could focus simply on the amethyst part and make it so you would have to spike a vex with an amethyst crystal. This would be you hitting a vex with an amethyst crystal. This would use up the crystal and turn the vex purple. It would start colliding with blocks and fly sporadically all around the room ricocheting off of blocks. In this state pillagers would be hostile towards the converting vex and the converting vex would have very low hp.

After 5 minutes. the vexes convert :)

Something would be nice, because I lost half of the allays I obtained on my long walk back home due to what I believe to be pathfinder issues. Hours wasted. As it stands right now, I may just sacrifice a stack of diamonds every time I want an allay, and give myself a spawn egg. :(
How does it spawn?

Boss fight? After building a structure reminiscent of the wither or iron golem with bone blocks (“fossils”) and then a skull from a different dimension like the end. Only able to spawn in the desert of course, drops a fairly op but very useful item, wither drops wither star for a beacon so something relating to that perhaps? Maybe increase beacon range or making an upgrade to the elytra which allows for the elytra chestplate, which would be very cool and concurrent with game logic if the wither spawns from wither skeleton skulls perhaps the death worm can spawn from floating miniature leviathan creatures in the end dimension, like the ones seen in Avengers Assemble, maybe you get their teeth to attach to end stone in a 3x3 grid on the end of the fossil to spawn it and they have like a 0.5% chance of dropping from the little leviathans. It’d tie in quite nicely as things seem to float in the end, elytra, shulker projectiles, new leviathan. And with the leviathan being fairly armoured it would tie the elytra to additional armour? Could be further balanced out with a special configuration for making a crafting station to combine the elytra and netherite chestplate, maybe netherite crafting bench made from 4 blocks of netherite or something end related
That sounds awesome great idea
Yes! It would add some more color to Minecraft, and it would be different from the normal colors.
I agree, Having only one color variation is a little bland.
i don't think hippos, giraffes, zebra and lions would work. they would overly change the game
Ostriches and termites and another new type of wood was already confirmed 3 years ago
There needs to be a Savannah update with Lions Cheetahs Egrets Hippopotamuses honey badgers but all Tameable
Also, they need to have a little bit more of uses
cool idea!
that seems cool, but I feel like the bats would just get in the way and I might hit them accidentally. A relaxing caving trip would turn into a cavern of random squeaks.
Lots of info I like it I'm always reading ideas that are short or have no information about the mob this is a good change of pace.
I think you meant Penguins, but imagine Piguins, which would be the Nether equivalent
Yes, please
Geweldig dit beestje
Great idea. Maybe you could set them to a POI like a bed to make them wander no more than 48 blocks away from the POI, so we don't lose our pets.

big YES! I would like to put up a shepherd dog in my sheep pen, it would be more atmospheric if the dog actually wandered around, instead of just sitting around.

perhaps even if there is some certain block, Idk which could be used, but if that dog is near some sheep, and a wandering pet dog, the dog should chase the sheep so they stay around that block.
bruh we getting into ARK survival stuff here.
Great idea! I would love to see that feature in-game!
It makes bats useful.

This is such a good idea! it would also add to the fact that the developers want something to be the fault of the players, so there must be a way to stop things, in this case the attacking of the warden.

This would require bats to be able to be transported, and the "bat buckets" I read, just don't sound right, maybe you can train bats for your cave adventures. Maybe you feed them apples, or something. They would ride on your shoulder, and help fend off the warden.

I do think that the bat making the warden run away is too OP, as a person with no gear could be fine if they had a bat. Instead, the bats just make the warden disoriented, and attack air blocks and run in the wrong direction. It will still attack you, and probably kill you and your bat, but the bat would have still helped you.
What if the Warden scare you. For examble, you are in a cave and just from the dark the face of the Warden appears and shocks you

Same should logically apply to dolphins, I know the odds of these two ever encountering one another are slim to none but should you for some reason be willing to make the effort to transport a dolphin all the way down there you should be rewarded for thinking so far outside the box.
Yeah always wanted to tame and ride dragons tame with chorus fruit

At Minecraft Live we seen dynamic texture on Warden's chest, so dynamic Glow Squid texture is also possible. Don't know how difficult to make dynamic "Endemen's/Spiders' eyes-like" glowing effect, but completely support this suggestion.
This would be a very cool mob to add to this update... who doesn't want a deep cave sea beast!
Yes! good idea! I know this animals from my knowledge!
We need Bison!
It would be great if they would be able to stampede.
They would drop bison meat
This would be a really cool mob to be seen! However, they should have a cave biome for them to spawn in.

366765816612 Thank you for your feedback! 

Personally, I would place the eye stalks in all caves because I would like the eye stalks to be a quick and easily obtainable food source for the player to come across. I do like the biome idea though. What kind of cave biome were you thinking of?
I don't know what cave biome they would fit in but I bet they would fit in a very scary one.

Been playing with a data pack that ensures all the blocks are dropped, which does keep Creepers entertaining for sure, this would make an excellent toggleable rule, that any explosion drops all blocks, but still destroys dropped items. 

As for the footsteps, I think all creature movements come up as footsteps, barely caught a creeper one time as I wasn't moving but the subtle had "Foot steps", Now giving mobs a unique movement sound could be cool, though in all honesty Creepers being biome camouflage and getting a unique movement sound would give a fun balance. In most Creepers are sometimes too easy to spot from afar, which sorta goes against the name sake, of being some sort of ambusher.
To OP
